title: Stalker
reflection: A meditation on desire, faith, and the nature of reality. Tarkovsky's slow, deliberate camera movements create a sense of time that feels both eternal and immediate. The Zone becomes a metaphor for the inner landscape—a place where wishes come true, but at a cost we can't predict.

title: Paterson
reflection: A week in the life of a bus driver who writes poetry. Jarmusch finds beauty in routine, in the small moments that make up a life. The film asks: what if the ordinary is extraordinary? What if the purpose of art is simply to notice?

title: The Tree of Life
reflection: Malick attempts nothing less than to capture the universe—from the Big Bang to a single family in 1950s Texas. The film moves between cosmic and intimate scales, suggesting that every moment contains eternity, that memory and time are not linear but layered.
